intro: Neogaillonia asperuliformis, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of East Asia, including China and Japan, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a rough or hairy texture, and its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow-green in color. It produces a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, a common trait among members of its family. Neogaillonia asperuliformis is often found in woodland areas and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
